description: Persian مهماندار‎ (mehmândâr), compound of مهمان‎ (mehmân, “guest”) and دار‎ (-dâr, “keeper, holder, one who has”).

entries.meaning: An official courier appointed to escort an important traveller in Persian-speaking countries and the Indian subcontinent.
examples: His mehmandar stood by, fresh as a clover from their walk, his arms crossed on his Aiantian chest.
